The '''Type L''' is a [[Anti-tank grenade|anti-tank hand grenade]] provided to the [[Royal Italian Army]] during [[World War II]].
== Description == [[File:Tipo L.jpg|left|thumb|A Type L in a World War II picture|210x210px]] Designed for anti-tank use is practically an [[OTO Mod. 35|OTO]] inside a painted red cylindrical container filled with 1500 gr explosive charge with a wooden handle to facilitate the launch.
The type L is designed to be used against vehicles and [[tank]]s, the bomb had essentially the task of destroying the track to immobilize it, since the charge was insufficient for its destruction, but made the tank still vulnerable to possible attacks from the infantry, the soldiers at this point proceeded to place explosive charges or throw incendiary grenades into the engine compartment covered by some smoke grenade.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Le armi della fanteria italiana nella seconda guerra mondiale|last=Pignato|first=Nicola|publisher=Ermanno Albertelli Editore|year=1971|isbn=|location=|pages=|quote=|via=}}</ref>
The bomb consists of a metal casing with a wooden throwing handle. On the upper part of the casing there is a tab for removing the safety pin, and a small metal strip protruding from the base of the handle. The strip is a second safety precaution.The metal strip is held in position by the wire on the side of the handle. This wire is held in position by a piece of wired tape secured by a pin.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.talpo.it/l-anticarro.html|title=Description of the bomb on Talpo.it|last=Talpo|first=Marco|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref>
== Operative Use == Before launching the L type it is necessary to remove the metal tab security at the base of the cylinder containing the explosive charge, then, firmly holding the handle, remove the pin at the base of the handle. Make sure that the wire rewind safely. When the grenade is thrown, the wire releases the second safety pin.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.t.lonesentry.com/articles/ttt34/italian-l-type-grenade.html|title=Descriptio on the correct throw from US troops field manual|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref>
